definitions: being limited or moderate in size, amount, or degree
showing humility and not drawing attention to one's abilities or achievements
avoiding indecency or impropriety, especially in dress and behavior
examples: They live in a modest house near the city center
The company reported modest profits this quarter despite challenges
She remained modest about her incredible scientific achievements
He gave a modest smile when praised for his work
She wore a modest dress to the formal dinner
The beach has modest changing facilities for visitors

definitions: used, done, or experienced by two or more people together
divided and distributed among multiple people or groups equally
examples: The students worked in a shared workspace on campus
They created shared documents for the collaborative project
The shared profits were distributed among all team members
They have shared custody of their children after divorce

definitions: very great in amount, effect, or strength that is difficult to resist
causing someone to have strong emotional feelings that are difficult to control
examples: The overwhelming majority of voters supported the new policy
She faced overwhelming evidence against her initial theory
The kindness of strangers was overwhelming during difficult times
He felt an overwhelming sense of gratitude toward his mentors

definitions: relating to Spain or Spanish-speaking countries, especially those of Latin America
relating to people of Latin American origin or descent living in the US
examples: The museum features Hispanic art from various Latin American countries
She studied Hispanic literature focusing on twentieth century works
The city has a large Hispanic population from diverse backgrounds
They celebrated Hispanic Heritage Month with traditional music and food

definitions: relating to, coming from, or being God or a deity
informal use meaning extremely good, pleasing, or delightful in quality
examples: Many cultures believe in divine intervention during times of crisis
The ancient texts describe divine wisdom passed to humanity
The chocolate cake tasted absolutely divine after the long hike
She looked divine in her wedding dress yesterday evening

definitions: having or showing a mild, kind, or tender temperament or character
moderate in action, effect, or degree; not harsh or severe
examples: The nurse had a gentle manner with frightened patients
He spoke in a gentle voice to calm the children
Use gentle pressure when cleaning the delicate fabric surface
The gentle breeze made the hot afternoon more bearable

definitions: sad because one has no friends or company to share experiences
of a place characterized by isolation and lacking inhabitants or visitors
examples: She felt lonely after moving to the new city
The elderly man was lonely without his wife's companionship
They drove down a lonely road through the desert
The lighthouse stands on a lonely cliff overlooking the sea

definitions: relating to the practice or science of collecting and analyzing numerical data
calculated or determined through statistical methods and probability theory
examples: The research team conducted statistical analysis of population trends
She teaches statistical methods to graduate students every semester
There's no statistical significance between the two experimental groups
The report includes statistical evidence supporting the new policy

definitions: having existed or continued for a long time, especially many years
examples: She visited her longtime friend from elementary school days
The company lost a longtime employee who retired last month
They're longtime residents of this neighborhood since the 1980s
He's been a longtime supporter of environmental conservation efforts

definitions: having a solid, almost hard surface or structure that resists pressure
strongly felt and unlikely to change; fixed and definite in nature
showing resolute determination and strength of character in decisions or actions
examples: The mattress was firm enough to support her back properly
Make sure the ladder is on firm ground before climbing
They reached a firm agreement after hours of negotiation
The company has firm policies regarding workplace safety standards
She remained firm in her decision despite family pressure
The teacher was firm but fair with classroom rules

definitions: so delicate or precise as to be difficult to analyze or describe
making use of clever and indirect methods to achieve something
examples: The painting had subtle shades of blue throughout the landscape
Her perfume had a subtle fragrance of jasmine flowers
He noticed subtle changes in her behavior over time
The novel contains subtle criticism of modern society

definitions: relating to ordinary citizens rather than the military or police forces
examples: The soldier returned to civilian life after military service
They changed from military uniforms into civilian clothes
The organization provides support for civilian victims of war
Civilian casualties must be avoided during military operations

definitions: demanding that rules concerning behavior are obeyed and observed rigidly
demanding total accuracy or giving no room for interpretation or flexibility
examples: The school has strict rules about mobile phone usage
Her parents were strict about homework before television time
Follow strict guidelines when handling these dangerous chemicals
The recipe requires strict attention to measurement and timing

definitions: truly what something is said to be; authentic and not counterfeit
of a person or emotion being sincere and honest rather than pretended
examples: The expert confirmed the painting was a genuine Picasso
Make sure to buy genuine replacement parts for safety
She showed genuine concern for her neighbor's health problems
His genuine enthusiasm for the project inspired the team

definitions: certain to happen and unable to be avoided or prevented by any means
examples: Death and taxes are often called life's inevitable realities
Given the circumstances, conflict seemed inevitable between them
The inevitable conclusion was that changes were desperately needed
It was inevitable that technology would transform the industry

definitions: achieving or producing a significant amount or result efficiently and effectively
relating to or engaged in the production of goods, crops, or other commodities
examples: She had a productive meeting with potential business partners
The team had their most productive quarter in company history
The region has productive farmland ideal for growing wheat
These productive factories employ thousands of local workers

definitions: first in order of importance; main or primary among several elements
relating to an original sum of money invested or lent
examples: Safety is our principal concern during the construction project
The principal reason for delays was unexpected weather conditions
She pays both principal and interest on her mortgage monthly
The principal amount of the loan was fifty thousand dollars

definitions: having or seeming to have no end or limit in space or time
occurring so frequently as to seem without limit or interruption
examples: The desert stretched in endless waves of golden sand
Space contains endless possibilities for exploration and discovery
The meeting felt endless as they debated minor details
She faced endless questions about her research findings

definitions: relating to or concerned with the way people or animals act or conduct themselves
examples: The child needs behavioral therapy to manage anger issues
Scientists study behavioral patterns in migrating bird populations
The company implemented new behavioral guidelines for employees
Behavioral economics examines how people make financial decisions

definitions: not interesting or exciting; causing someone to feel weary and impatient
examples: The documentary was so boring that half the audience left
He found the repetitive factory work extremely boring
The speaker gave a boring presentation about tax regulations
Waiting in line for hours was boring and frustrating

definitions: having barriers or doors shut preventing access or passage
not willing to consider new ideas or others' opinions
examples: The store was closed when we arrived at nine
Keep the windows closed during the storm tonight
He has a closed mind about alternative medicine treatments
The closed society resisted any outside cultural influences

definitions: free from disturbance; tranquil and calm without noise or worry
not involving war or violence; characterized by peace rather than conflict
examples: The garden was a peaceful retreat from city noise
She enjoyed peaceful mornings reading by the lake
The countries maintained peaceful relations for fifty years
They organized a peaceful protest against the new law

definitions: unhappy, disappointed, or worried about something that has happened
having a disturbed physical condition, especially of the stomach
examples: She was upset when her flight was suddenly cancelled
The children were upset about moving to another school
Spicy food often gives him an upset stomach afterwards
The rough seas made several passengers feel upset

definitions: based on or in accordance with reason or logic rather than emotion
having the ability to think clearly, sensibly, and logically
examples: We need a rational approach to solving this complex problem
Her rational analysis helped the team avoid costly mistakes
Humans are considered rational beings capable of abstract thought
He remained rational despite the emotional nature of the debate

definitions: having a sharp, pungent taste or smell that is unpleasant
feeling or showing anger, hurt, or resentment from bad experiences
of weather extremely cold with an unpleasant piercing quality
examples: The medicine had a bitter taste that lingered afterwards
Dark chocolate can be quite bitter without added sugar
She felt bitter about being passed over for promotion
Their bitter divorce affected the whole family badly
The bitter wind made it painful to be outside
They endured a bitter winter with record low temperatures

definitions: priced within one's financial means; not expensive relative to income
examples: The city needs more affordable housing for young families
They found an affordable restaurant near the theater district
These affordable smartphones offer excellent value for money
Community colleges provide affordable education options for many students

definitions: relating to or characteristic of art or artists and their work
having or revealing natural creative skill and aesthetic sensitivity
examples: She has artistic talent in both painting and sculpture
The museum displays artistic treasures from ancient civilizations
The chef's artistic presentation made each dish visually stunning
He has an artistic temperament and sees beauty everywhere

definitions: having a natural aptitude or skill for something; gifted in particular areas
examples: The talented musician could play five different instruments well
She's a talented writer who published her first novel at twenty
The company actively recruits talented engineers from top universities
He's talented at solving complex mathematical problems quickly

definitions: without covering or clothing; naked or uncovered
only just sufficient; with nothing left over or additional
examples: The bare walls needed painting and decoration
He walked on the beach with bare feet
They survived on the bare minimum of food and water
She gave only the bare facts without any details

definitions: unable to be seen by the eye, either by nature or concealment
treated as if unable to be seen; ignored or not acknowledged socially
examples: Ultraviolet light is invisible to the human eye
The clear glass door was almost invisible in dim light
She felt invisible at the party where nobody talked to her
Homeless people often feel invisible to mainstream society

definitions: relating to or concerned with the official rules made by authorities to control activities
examples: The company must comply with regulatory requirements for safety
New regulatory changes affect how banks operate their business
She works for a regulatory agency monitoring environmental standards
The regulatory framework ensures fair competition in the market

definitions: able to be reached, entered, or obtained without difficulty or special effort
easily understood or appreciated; not overly complex or technical
examples: The building is accessible by wheelchair users through ramps
Public transportation makes the city center easily accessible
The professor makes complex theories accessible to undergraduate students
This accessible guide explains quantum physics in simple terms

definitions: showing an ability to take risks; confident and courageous
having a strong or vivid appearance; standing out prominently
examples: She made a bold decision to start her own company
The explorer's bold journey took him through dangerous territory
The artist used bold colors in her abstract paintings
He wore a bold red tie to the conservative meeting

definitions: relating to Greece, its people, language, or culture from any historical period
examples: She studied Greek philosophy focusing on Aristotle and Plato
The restaurant serves authentic Greek food like moussaka
Ancient Greek architecture influenced Western building design significantly
He's learning Greek to read classical texts in the original

definitions: designed to be practical and useful rather than attractive or decorative
working or operating in the proper or expected way
examples: The kitchen has a functional design maximizing storage space
She prefers functional clothing suitable for outdoor activities
After repairs, the elevator is fully functional again
We need to keep all safety equipment functional at all times

definitions: roughly calculated or judged the value, number, quantity, or extent of something
examples: The estimated cost of the project is two million dollars
She gave an estimated arrival time of three o'clock
The estimated population of the city exceeds one million
Weather services provided estimated rainfall totals for the storm

definitions: said, without proof, to have taken place or to have a specified quality
examples: The alleged crime took place last Tuesday night downtown
She denied all alleged connections to the fraud scheme
The newspaper reported on alleged corruption in city government
His alleged involvement in the scandal remains under investigation

definitions: advocating or supporting a system of government without a monarch; relating to a republic
relating to the Republican Party, one of two major political parties in the United States
examples: The country adopted republican principles after overthrowing the monarchy
She wrote about republican ideals in eighteenth century France
The republican candidate won the gubernatorial election last November
They attended a republican fundraiser in the state capital

definitions: highly unpleasant, especially to the senses; physically nauseating or disgusting
behaving in a spiteful, violent, or bad-tempered way
dangerous, serious, or painful in effect or consequence
examples: There was a nasty smell coming from the garbage disposal
The medicine had a nasty taste that made children refuse it
She made nasty comments about her former friend's appearance
He has a nasty habit of gossiping about coworkers
She suffered a nasty fall down the stairs yesterday
The storm caused nasty damage to coastal properties

definitions: plain or obvious; clearly seen or understood from available evidence or facts
examples: It was evident that she had been crying from her red eyes
The damage to the building was evident from the street
His talent for mathematics became evident in elementary school
The evident solution was to hire more qualified staff

definitions: existing or coming before in time, order, or importance
regarded as more important than something else
examples: She had no prior experience in marketing before this job
Check for prior approval before starting the construction project
Family obligations take prior claim over work commitments
The hospital gives prior attention to emergency cases

definitions: having the right to do or obtain something through satisfying appropriate conditions
examples: Students with good grades are eligible for scholarship programs
Only citizens over eighteen are eligible to vote
She became eligible for retirement benefits after twenty years
Check if you're eligible for the tax deduction this year

definitions: covered with or containing blood; bleeding
involving or characterized by bloodshed or cruelty
British informal used to express anger or for emphasis
examples: The nurse cleaned the bloody wound with antiseptic solution
He had a bloody nose after the basketball accident
The country's bloody civil war lasted for five years
Medieval history includes many bloody battles for territory
It's bloody cold outside this morning
That was a bloody difficult exam to pass

definitions: occurring, appearing, or done infrequently and irregularly; happening from time to time
examples: She enjoys the occasional glass of wine with dinner
We have occasional meetings to discuss project progress
The desert receives occasional rainfall during winter months
He makes occasional visits to his hometown

definitions: able to be maintained at a certain rate or level over time
able to be upheld or defended; using resources without depleting them for future generations
examples: The company needs sustainable growth to remain profitable long-term
This pace of work is not sustainable for employees
They practice sustainable farming methods to protect the soil
The city invested in sustainable energy sources like solar power

definitions: of a man good-looking with pleasing physical features and appearance
of an amount substantial or considerable; larger than usual or expected
examples: The handsome actor starred in several romantic films
She introduced her handsome boyfriend to her parents
They made a handsome profit from the real estate investment
The charity received a handsome donation from an anonymous benefactor

definitions: the total amount before any deductions such as tax or expenses
extremely unpleasant to the senses; disgusting or repulsive
glaringly obvious and unacceptable; showing lack of sensitivity
examples: Her gross salary is higher than her take-home pay
The company reported gross earnings of ten million dollars
The spoiled food smelled really gross after a week
He made gross noises while eating his soup
It was a gross violation of human rights
The report contained gross errors in calculation

definitions: representing an exemplary standard within a traditional and long-established form or style
relating to ancient Greek or Latin literature, art, or culture
examples: She trained in classical ballet at the prestigious academy
The orchestra performed classical music by Mozart and Beethoven
He studied classical languages including Latin and ancient Greek
The museum houses classical sculptures from the Roman era

definitions: relating to or forming part of the structure of a building or system
examples: The engineer identified structural damage after the earthquake
They made structural changes to improve the building's stability
The report analyzed structural problems in the education system
Structural unemployment results from fundamental economic changes

definitions: based on reasoning conducted according to strict principles of validity
characterized by or capable of clear, sound reasoning; reasonable to expect
examples: She presented a logical argument for changing company policy
The detective followed a logical process to solve the case
It's logical to assume prices will rise with increased demand
The most logical conclusion is that someone made an error
